comment:
Do not take Dytoc if you plan on taking extra electives or extracurriculars. His classes are very intensive and demand a lot of work outside class hours.
That being said, he is a good professor, and if you are able to dedicate the full time and effort he demands, his class is fun and very educational. He grades on craftsmanship, and allows redo's.

His critiques are tough and may hurt your feelings but he really wants his students to do the best they can and will work extra with students if they need help. He teaches fundamental basics so that students can apply what they learn from a point of understanding rather than memorization.
Expect 10+ hours of homework every other night, horrible teaching style, and no social life. Would never take again. Made rude comments about students every day.

Dytoc is a great structures professor! He makes sure that you understand the material before moving on, but won't baby you if you are falling behind. Ask questions! Several group and indv. assignments. Dont miss those because you really need that practice for the tests. Go to SI sessions too, those help. Overall, cool dude, really enthusiastic

Show that you are caring about class: be on time every time, etc. most of the class will be self taught. Use youtube. Be very proficient in using a straight edge, triangles, and compass and drawings will be much easier. Create models with the highest degree of perfection. Always use fresh blades on xacto knife for clean cuts. Lots of time in studio

Be prepared for grading criteria to be unclear and change throughout projects, work through weekends and holidays or you will recive a lesser grade. For technical drawings, do best to have consistent line weight and darkness. Avoid smudges at all cost. For models, recommended straight lines only, as this will be much easier to translate to drawings

Has told students that he intentionally gives out B grades because it makes them work harder. To pass the class(studio 1001): study art and drawing beforehand(gesture, charcoal, perspective of buildings, etc). The first module pretty much sets the standard for how he will grade u throughout. CRAFTSMANSHIP IS KEY. Youtube helps for modelmaking.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I love Professor Dytoc! Hes so energetic Im class and fun to be around. The course attendance is not mandatory but if you miss a class you will fall behind! He places you in groups where you will do most homeworks and assignments. Overall, there is a decent amount of homework but if you do it you will most likely do well in the class and on test
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Dytoc is by far one of the best teachers at KSU! If you put in the effort into his class he will go above and beyond for you. Yes his class is a little difficult but you will learn a great deal from this man.

I really enjoyed taking Dytoc for studio, he is a really cool guy and is easy to talk to and ask questions. Studio is a hard class so almost any professor you take is going to be difficult. You won't know your overall grade until the end of the semester, but he leaves his grading sheets to see individual scores. He also lets you redo work.

I have rarely seen teachers that will talk to the class and relate as well as he has.  He takes our classes grades as a reflection of how well he is teaching.  Always willing to help, and guide us to understanding lessons using creative techniques.  The class is a bit challenging, but fair.

Prof. Dytoc possesses one key ingredient to excellent teaching: inner peace and contentment. He offers guidance to his students and shows up with creative, fun energy on a consistent basis. I would recommend him for any class, and encourage open discussion with him. He is not only candid, but humble in his ability to relate to students.
Great Professor! I would take any of his classes again. Yes, he uses riddles, but that's what makes the topic interesting. He will never hesitate to help with anything that you might need.

In the beginning, I was really excited to take his class. I knew that he gave out a lot of work and that you had to stay on top of it. But, when I needed help, he hardly gave me feedback on my projects, I felt lost, and this was why I dropped out of his class. Do not take him unless you aren't big on feedback.

you can only survive this his class if you're serious about Architecture and willing to work HARD. He'll tell you what the objective of the assigned project is and leave you to use your creativity to meet its requirements. He's big on HAND drafted drawings and stresses perfection so be ready to re-do drawings and models when necessary. He's funny

Um..Dytoc was def my 1st choice this sem and was really excited about taking studio with him-however, his teaching style changed from what I was used to. Don't take him unless you love to redo everything, receive zero feedback, and redo everything again. Only take him if you are willing to work HARDER than you expect yourself to-Would Not Recommend
Cares about each student and his/her work. Very thoughtful and helpful critiques. He is witty and a fun prof. Be prepared to work hard for an A though. Would recommend.
Very good professor, but he speaks in riddles. Which isn't necessarily a bad thing.

Basically, all grades are subjective and he doesn't give you strict criteria from which to work.  HE IS THE ONLY ARCHITECTURE PROFESSOR WHO WILL ABSOLUTELY  FAIL YOU.  He talks in riddles and it is usually hard to decipher them. If you care about your GPA, there are far better Arch professors worth looking into. Crout, I hear, is fantastic.

no one speaks up against the studio teachers. dytoc is prob the coolest teacher i have ever met, corny ass jokes, but overall a cool guy.  terrible teacher that never makes sense. his peer grading is what will screw your life up.who lets students grade their peers?! your grade is based on how many good friends you have in the class.NOT RECOMMENDED!
